body_html: I let ivan create the bug issue but I confirm that the new behavior can cause some troubles. I am using sparse_softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits and, in my opinion, the best behavior would be to return a loss of 0.0 and null gradients when the label is not in the range [0, num_classes); never return nan.
body_text: I let ivan create the bug issue but I confirm that the new behavior can cause some troubles. I am using sparse_softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits and, in my opinion, the best behavior would be to return a loss of 0.0 and null gradients when the label is not in the range [0, num_classes); never return nan.
body: I let ivan create the bug issue but I confirm that the new behavior can cause some troubles. I am using `sparse_softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits` and, in my opinion, the best behavior would be to return a loss of _0.0_ and null gradients when the label is not in the range _[0, num_classes)_; never return _nan_.
